title: Russian style block font TYPE ID NEEDED
content:
this looks pretty custom but does anybody know a font similar to this blocky font? Thanks,  
Danny

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [Picture 5.png](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706103545/http:/typophile.com/files/Picture%205_22.png) | 912.28 KB |

 [‹ Oregon Font ID](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706103545/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45193 "Go to previous forum topic") [Please help identifying these typefaces ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706103545/http:/www.typophile.com/node/45207 "Go to next forum topic")
author: SKUMATIK

comments.content:
my apologies for the messed up image...

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706103545im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/russianfont_4313.jpg)

I’ve already asked for indentification for a similar face (if not the same)  
 [http://typophile.com/node/35726](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706103545/http:/typophile.com/node/35726 "http://typophile.com/node/35726")

The closest I could find of this uppercase “A” is Mark Simonson’s Mostra N°3

[El Grande](http://web.archive.org/web/20080706103545/http:/www.fontbureau.com/fonts/sans/ElGrande) has some of the blocky feel, but less contrast.

- Mike Yanega
